intro: Oreodaphne martiniana var. opaca, commonly known as the dark oreodaphne, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves that are elliptical in shape. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a small, woody capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
